intro: Sisyrinchium flaviflorum, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, showy yellow flowers with a distinctive blue or purple throat. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in fine hairs. Sisyrinchium flaviflorum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
